TextView.android:text: Cooking Recpies
Boneless Pork Loin Roast

Pork Loin 4 Lbs 
Whole Cranberry Sauce 1 Can 
Chopped Onion 1/4 Cup 
Orange Juice 3/4 Cup 
Ground Ginger 1/4 Teaspoons 
Cinnamon 1/4 Teaspoons
Roast meat at 325 degrees for 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Let stand 20 minutes before slicing into serving dish. Pour sauce over meat and return to oven 10 to 15 minutes
Bavarian Chops

Boneless Pork Loin Chops 4 Numbers 
Butter 1 Teaspoons 
Chopped Green Onions 1/2 Cup 
Minced Garlic 2 Clove 
Mushrooms 1/2 Slice 
Thyme 1/2 Teaspoons 
Warm Beer 8 oz 
Flour

Lightly flour 4 chops. Melt butter on medium high heat and quickly brown chops on both sides. Remove. Saute onions, garlic and mushrooms and thyme. Return chops to skillet. Add beer, bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper
Beef Tips And Gravy

Beef Tips 1 Lbs 
Chopped Onion 1 Numbers 
Flour 1/2 Cup 
Salt 1 Teaspoons 
Black Pepper 1/2 Teaspoons 
Oil 1/2 Cup

Roll beef tips in flour, salt, and pepper. Drop in hot oil. Brown; remove. Add chopped onion; saute. Add browned beef tips and water to make gravy. Cover and simmer 30 minutes or until tender. Serve with rice, creamed potatoes, or biscuits.
Bishops Meat Loaf

Put meat in bowl, add onions, bread, green pepper, garlic, applesauce, parsley, salt and pepper. Add egg and mix well. Form into loaf and flour well. Oil pan and place loaf in pan. Add catsup on top of loaf. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours, uncovering for last 15 minutes

1. Take one bowl to season the chicken first add pepper,salt,soya sauce(one or two drops) Mix it and keep it aside.
2. Take chicken stock add salt,sugar,pepper soya sauce oyster sauce bottle chilly sauce,venigar and mix it up. Heat the oil in a large sauce pan and add chicken, when chicken is ¾ cooked, add chopped ginger garlic and green,red,yellow capsicum, carrot, cabbage, spring onions, and add sauce mixture.
3. All vegetables and chicken well cooked add noodles, and toss them.
4. Switch off the flame and add spring onions and sesame seeds.
Savory Blade Pot Roast

Blade Bone Pot Roast 3 Lbs 
Wine Vinegar 1/4 Cup 
Cooking Oil 1/4 Cup 
Ketchup 1/4 Cup 
Soy Sauce 2 Tablespoons 
Worcestershire Sauce 2 
Garlic Powder 1/2 Tablespoons 
Dried Rosemary 1 Teaspoons 
Dry Mustard 1/2 Teaspoons

In a skillet, brown meat slowly in a small amount of hot oil. Sprinkle meat with a little salt. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meat. Cover tightly and simmer 2 hours or until tender. Remove meat and skim fat
Ground Beef Stroganoff

Ground Beef, Lean 1 Pound 
Onion, Chopped 2 Small 
Garlic Salt 1/2 Teaspoons 
Pepper 1/4 Teaspoons 
Cream Of Mushroom Soup, Condensed 3/4 Ounces 
Mushroom Stems And Pieces, Drained 4 Ounces 
Sour Cream, Or Yogurt 3/4 Cup

In medium skillet, brown ground beef and onion; drain excess fat. Stir in garlic salt, pepper, soup and mushrooms. Simmer covered, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in sour cream; heat through, but do not boil. Serve over rice, noodles or chow mein noodles.
Crock Pot Beef Roast

Roast Beef Or Round Steak 3,4 Pound 
Salt And Pepper To Taste 
Onion, Chopped 1 Small 
Brown Gravy Mix 1 Numbers 
Water 1 Cup 
Catsup 1/2 Cup 
Dijon Mustard 2 Teaspoons 
Garlic Powder 1/2 Cup
Red Wine 1/2 Cup

Place meat in slow cooking pot. Sprinkle meat with salt and pepper. Combine remaining ingredients; pour over meat. Cover and cook on low 8-10 hours.\nIf desired, add small peeled potatoes and carrots. Sauce can be thickened with 2 tablespoons flour dissolved in ¼ cup of water.\nI usually skip the potatoes and carrots and mix the roast or round steak with egg noodles
Beef Fondue
Boneless Sirloin 1/3 Lbs\nPeanut Oil 4 Cup \nFondue Pot Or Electric Deep Dish Cooker

Cut beef into small cubes (1x2 inch) and keep chilled until about 1 hour before cooking. Set electric fondue to 360 degrees and add oil (be careful with hot oil). Each guest is given a plate of raw meat and cooking fork (also a separate eating fork). \nThey spear one piece and cook to individual preference. It takes a little experimentation. Offer a variety of 4 to 6 sauces. Bottled or experiment with your own exciting recipes. Serve with baked potato, vegetables and a green tossed salad. \nThis is a wonderful entertaining meal. Great for conversation and a long evening. NOTE: It is best to have no more than 6 people cooking in one pot for convenience and safety reasons. Also not recommended for children under 8.
Applesauce Beef Loaf

Soft Bread Crumbs 1 Cup 
Applesauce 1/2 Cup 
Ground Beef 1 Lbs 
Slightly Beaten Egg 1 Numbers 
Chopped Onion 2 Tablespoons 
Celery Flakes 1 Teaspoons 
Dijon Mustard 1 Teaspoons 
Salt 1 Teaspoons 
Applesauce 1/2 Cup 
Brown Sugar 1/2 Cup 
Vinegar 1 Tablespoons 
Dijon Mustard 1 Teaspoons
Blend first nine ingredients thoroughly. Shape into a round loaf in a 9'x9' baking pan. With a spoon make a 'crater' in top of loaf. Combine next 4 ingredients and pour into depression
Chicken Salad

Vinegar 2 Teaspoons 
Oil 1 Teaspoons 
Mayonnaise 2 Tablespoons 
Tangerines Or Mandarin Oranges 1 Can 
Pineapple, Chopped 1 Can 
Asparagus 1 Can 
Mushrooms 1 Can
Chicken, Cooked, Boned And Chopped 1 Numbers
Mix all ingredients. Do not refrigerate before using.

Medium Tomatoes, Chopped 5 Numbers 
Salt 1 Teaspoons 
Dried Thyme 1/4 Teaspoons 
Vegetable Oil 1/2 Cup 
Worcestershire Sauce 1 Tablespoons 
Sugar 1 Tablespoons
Dried Basil 1 Teaspoon
Freshly Ground Pepper 1/4 Teaspoons 
Vinegar 6 Tablespoons 
Onion, Diced 1 Large
Mix together: salt, dried thyme, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, dried basil, pepper, vinegar, and onions. Toss with tomatoes. Chill for about an hour and serve on lettuce leaves.

Red Cabbage 3 Pound 
Sour Green Apples 3 Numbers 
Onion 1 Large 
Lard 1/4 Cup 
Bay Leaf 1 Numbers 
Salt To Taste 
Sugar 4 Tablespoons 
White Vinegar 5 Tablespoons 
White Wine 1 Cup 
Cloves 3 Numbers

Peel, then chop up the apples. Put the lard in a large pot. Add onions and cook on medium heat until browned. Add shredded cabbage, apples, vinegar, white wine, sugar, salt, cloves, and bay leaf in that order. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer on low heat for two to three hours. If there is too much liquid, add a little bit of cornstarch to make it thicker.

Medium Potatoes (about 3 Pounds 10 Numbers 
Beef Broth 1 Can
All-purpose Flour 1/4 Cup 
Sugar 3 Tablespoons 
Celery Seed 1/2 Teaspoons 
Salt 1/2 Teaspoons 
Pepper 1/8 Tablespoons 
Cider Vinegar 1/4 Cup 
Medium Onion, Chopped (about 1/2 Cup) 1 Numbers 
Chopped Fresh Parsley 3 Tablespoons

In Dutch oven place potatoes. Cover with water. Over high heat, heat to a boil. Cook 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cut into cubes. \nIn medium saucepan gradually mix broth into flour, sugar, celery seed, salt and pepper until smooth. Add vinegar and onion. Over medium heat, cook until mixture boils and thickens, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Cook 5 minutes or until onion is tender. \nIn large bowl toss potatoes, parsley and broth mixture until evenly coated

Dark Bread 1 Lbs 
Water 2 Quart 
Caraway Seeds 1/2 Tablespoons 
Onion 1 Small \Fat 1 Numbers 
Bouillon Cubes Or Cream 2 Numbers 
Salt To Taste

Soak dark bread in water, bring to a boil, remove and strain. Bring to a boil again, if necessary adding more water. Season. Chop an onion finely and brown in fat, and add. Enrich, if desired, with bouillon cubes or cream.

Bacon, Thick, Diced 4 Slice 
Onions 2 Slice 
Turnip 1 Slice 
Carrots, Diced 2 Numbers 
Potatoes, Cubed 2 Numbers 
Head Green Cabbage, Shredded 1 Numbers 
Chicken Stock Or Bouillon 4 Cup 
Water 2 Cup 
Sprigs Parsley * 6 Numbers 
Bay Leaf * 1 Numbers

The 6 sprigs of parsley and 1 bay leaf should be tied together with a thread. \nIn a 6-quart saucepan or pot, combine all ingredients except salt, pepper and cheese. Simmer partially covered for 1-1/2 to 2 hours. Discard the parsley bundle; season to taste. Pour into hot soup bowls and garnish with cheese.

Flour 3 Cup 
Milk 1 Cup 
Egg, Separated 1 Numbers 
Sugar 1 Tablespoons 
Hazelnuts, Grated Salt 2 Tablespoons 
Butter 2 Tablespoons

Combine flour and milk. Stir in egg yolk, fold in sugar, hazelnuts and stiffly beaten egg white. Add salt to taste. Melt butter and fry omelet golden brown on both sides. Serve with stewed fruits or berries.

Potatoes, Peeled And Quartered 2 Pound 
Onion, Quartered 1 Large 
Milk 1/2 Cup 
Flour 1 Cup 
Flour With Drier Potatoes 1/2 Cup 
More Watery Potatoes 1 Cup 
Salt 2 Teaspoons 
Eggs 2 Numbers 
Vegetable Oil

Grate potatoes and onion into a bowl. Add milk, then stir in flour, salt, and eggs. Mix well.\nIn a large, heavy skillet heat 1/2 inch frying oil until hot. Drop potato batter (1/4 cup per pancake) into skillet and fry until golden brown and crisp on both sides. \nDrain on a paper towel.

Bacon 6 Slice 
Butter 1 Tablespoons 
Onion, Chopped 1 Numbers 
Potatoes, Cooked And Finely Diced 4 Numbers 
Eggs 6 Numbers 
Salt Freshly Ground Black Pepper 1/2 Teaspoons
Milk 1/4 Cup

In a frying pan, fry the bacon until crisp. Remove and drain on paper towel. Remove the bacon fat from the frying pan, add the butter and saute' the onion until soft. Add the potatoes and brown lightly. Beat the eggs lightly and add the salt, pepper and milk, and finally the chopped bacon. Pour the egg mixture over the onions and potatoes and stir occasionally until cooked.
Watermelon Ice
Watermelon Juice 3 Cup \nGranulated Sugar 1/3 Cup \nLemon Juice 1/4 Cup

In a saucepan, heat watermelon juice, lemon juice and sugar until sugar is dissolved. Do not boil! \nCool, then pour mixture into plastic tub. Put into freezer; stir mixture every 20 minutes until frozen, about two hours. Cover. Store in freezer. Spoon the ice into individual serving bowls.
Garlic Toast

Bread Slices 
Cheese as need 
Garlic 5 Numbers 
Butter as needed
In ding chick add garlic make a paste then add butter, cheese make afine paste.Take bread slices apply this mixture on top and gril it for 5min or till golden brown colour.
Black Forest Cake
Chocolate Cake Sheets 1 Numbers \nCream 1 Numbers\nSugar 1 Cup

Take blender blend cream and sugar and keep aside.In a bowl add water and sugar mix well keep a side.\nNow take the Cake sheets sprinkle sugar water and spread the cream and top it of with cherrys now the another layer of cake repeat the same process twice.\nAnd lastly spread the cream on the cake and top it of with cherrys, and sprinkle the chocolate.
